The spring force is given by Hooke's Law: \( F_s = kx \).
The normal force \( F_N \) is related to the spring force and the angle \( 	heta \).
The static friction force \( F_{fm} \) is given by \( F_{fm} = \mu F_N \).
The condition for self-locking is that the friction force must balance the component of the spring force along the latch.
The component of the spring force along the latch is \( F_s \sin 	heta \).
The component of the spring force perpendicular to the latch is \( F_s \cos 	heta \).
The normal force \( F_N \) is related to the perpendicular component of the spring force.
The friction force must balance the parallel component of the spring force: \( F_{fm} = F_s \sin 	heta \).
Substitute \( F_{fm} = \mu F_N \) into the balance equation.
Solve for \( F_N \) using the trigonometric identity \( \sin 30^\circ =  rac{1}{2} \) and \( \cos 30^\circ =  rac{\sqrt{3}}{2} \).
Combine the equations to find \( F_N \) in terms of \( k \), \( x \), \( \mu \), and \( 	heta \).
